metadata.titel_preek: The Glory of God in Christ (Epiphany)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His transcendent and immutable glory (Kavod/Doxa) in the person of Jesus Christ to rescue humanity from the dominion of darkness and transform them into His likeness.

tekstueel_bewijs: God shields his essence from us precisely with its manifestation
He originates our perception, guides our perception, corrects our perception
He has delivered us from the dominion of darkness

object.identificatie: The manifestation of Divine Glory / Salvation of the creature
tekstueel_bewijs: the glory of Christ who is the likeness of God, shining in and transforming our hearts
it is revealed only from God’s being... for the salvation of his creatures
Its source is the Creator himself and it emanates from him
to all who received him... he gave power to become children of God
we—in the fellowship of all the redeemed—are to become purified recipients

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Cross / The Word
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ, by his Holy Spirit, assures me of eternal life
the glory of Christ was paradoxically made known in his crucifixion

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Human Striving, and the 'Dominion of Darkness'
tekstueel_bewijs: every hostile power that would enslave his creation
human bondage to sin and death
the human psyche is always wired to take credit
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an ontological state of 'uncleanness' and 'death' that requires a divine 'body blow' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response of doxology and 'enjoyment' of God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Redeemed Human
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/worship) is strictly a consequence of the primary program (grace). We glorify God because He has first shone in our hearts.

subject_check.mens_als_subject_count: Low (mostly in passive or receptive roles)
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we might say that we saw a glorious sunset
man’s chief end is to glorify God

voorbeelden: the body of Christ needs to recommit
seeking a more obviously revelatory way
willing and ready from now on to live for him
Understanding the glory of Christ requires understanding the importance of kavod
God is able to save us
he gave power to become children of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability). It emphasizes that humans lack the 'Pouvoir' to see or save themselves, which must be gifted by the Subject (God).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Isaiah's terror/Job's repentance) to S1 (The Cross as Glory), specifically rejecting ~S1 (striving) and ~S2 (sentimentality).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved in the Cross, where the 'terror' of S2 and the 'glory' of S1 meet.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon emphasizes 'shock and awe' and 'fear and trembling'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly attacks anthropocentric 'religious' thinking and maintains God as the active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Wikipedia offers a definition of glory as... perceived by humans.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In biblical theology God is the subject of the sentences about himself.
Jesus has been presented as a moral exemplar... minus his unique identity as Son of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects using Jesus as a mere moral exemplar.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: These figures are presented as overwhelmed Receivers of a divine action, not as models for human imitation.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-salvation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: God acts (Soteriology), and man responds (Doxology/Ethics).
spanning_punten: The paradox of the Cross as the site of 'Glory'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ as Lord over every hostile power that would enslave his creation.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit assures and makes the believer 'willing and ready'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'uncleanness', 'bondage', and 'dominion of darkness'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject and the hearer as the Receiver. It avoids the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a healthy 'Grace' imbalance.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as Sin and Death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, rigorously maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the Subject of the active verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of light imagery; Greimas shows that the light is not just a metaphor but a functional Actant (Helper/Object) that changes the Subject's state.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 1:14; semiotics shows how the sermon's structure prevents the hearer from turning 'beholding glory' into a human work.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power lies in the 'Subject-Switch' from the human athlete seeking glory to the Divine Word who possesses it inherently.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (shields, grants, speaks, originates, guides, corrects, delivers)
The Church (needs to recommit, blesses, worships)
appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly uses the term 'Subject' in a grammatical/theological sense, aligning perfectly with Greimassian analysis.
